cluster_relations.rel_desc: Ancient Egyptian burial practices were shaped by and expressed ancient Egyptian beliefs about the afterlife.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject practice or doctrine is conceptually grounded in or derived from the object belief system or set of concepts.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Ancient Egyptian Afterlife Beliefs and Concepts
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Ancient Egyptians hold specific afterlife beliefs about the necessity of grave goods.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject (an individual or group) holds or maintains a belief concerning the object concept, proposition, or doctrine.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Ancient Egypt: Society, Rulers, and Funerary Culture
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Ancient Egyptian Afterlife Beliefs and Concepts
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: that these items would be needed in the afterlife
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: BeliefContent: need for items in afterlife

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The Book of the Dead functions within and supports ancient Egyptian afterlife beliefs by guiding the soul through the afterlife.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject text, practice, or artifact functionally supports, articulates, or operates within the object belief system.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Practices and Burials
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Ancient Egyptian Afterlife Beliefs and Concepts
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: BeliefAspect: journey and dangers of the afterlife

remarks: More inferential; created to capture the doctrinal basis of burial practices.

args.justification: The relation expresses that the 'Book of the Dead' conceptually and functionally supports the ancient Egyptian afterlife belief system, rather than the belief system using the text as an instrument. This is better modeled as a conceptual/functional ASSOCIATION between text and belief system, not as a USAGE relation where one entity uses another.
args.remark: Relabeled rel_cls_group from 'USAGE' to 'ASSOCIATION' to reflect that the text underpins and articulates the belief system, instead of the belief system actively using the text as a tool.

executed_decisions.justification: The relation expresses that the 'Book of the Dead' conceptually and functionally supports the ancient Egyptian afterlife belief system, rather than the belief system using the text as an instrument. This is better modeled as a conceptual/functional ASSOCIATION between text and belief system, not as a USAGE relation where one entity uses another.
executed_decisions.remark: Relabeled rel_cls_group from 'USAGE' to 'ASSOCIATION' to reflect that the text underpins and articulates the belief system, instead of the belief system actively using the text as a tool.
